field.name: summary
field.value: AbstractPaginationViewComponent with PreserveQueryString = true double-encodes query string parameters

field.name: description
field.value:
ViewComponents deriving from AbstractPaginationViewComponent will double-encode query string parameters if PreserveQueryString is true (and possibly in other cases as well).
For example, the query string parameter "&q.StartDate=08%2F01%2F2008" will become "&q.StartDate=08%252F01%252F2008" in the links to other pages.
This appears to happen because UrlParts.CreateQueryStringNameValueCollection() does not decode the query string parameters as it adds them to the NameValueCollection and the CommonUtils.BuildQueryString() method called by UrlParts.BuildPathForLink() encodes them again.

comment.author: mdavis
comment.text:
I've made a patch that seems to fix this, though I'd like it if someone would review it to make sure I didn't miss something important.
It adds a dependency on IServerUtility to UrlParts (as an additional constructor parameter) so that it can decode the query string parameters as it builds the NameValueCollection. I also removed the IServerUtility parameter from the BuildPathForLink() method as it would be redundant.
The patch also adds a test to verify that parsed query string parameters are decoded and re-encoded correctly.

comment.author: mdavis
comment.text: Since the original patch is almost a year old, I'm providing an updated patch that I believe should work on the current trunk. I'd still like someone to take a look at this in case there's a better way of fixing the problem, though.
